January 9, 1959
Dr. Harry Skornia
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
I had planned to beat you to the draw this year on the appointment
of the sub-committee to worry about the grants-In-aid. I thought
of it two weeks ago but then got so Involved in finishing up the
last draft of a research report for Iowa - my last major Job
for the University until my return-that I never got the
letters written. I am now writing to Merrill (whom I am asking
to be chairman), Harwood, Ellery, Smyth©, and West ley. I am sure
that Merrill, Harwood and Ellery have accepted Bill*s invitation
to be in the committee. I am not so sure about Westley and
Snythe. To be on the safe side with these, I am sending their
letters to you to forward to them in the ©vent* that they are on
the committee. If they are not, or If you want to keep one copy
at headquarters Instead of sending all of them out, you can
drop the letter to the person who is not on the committee —
or if one did not accept and It Is all right to sand out all
copies of the proposal, I would add Evans (Whom I assume is the
Houston Evans In psychology. Bill Just said Evans.) This Is
a very confusing sentence above but I hope that you get the gist
of it. As you can see from the enclosed letters, I am asking
everyone to sex*d his recommendations to Merrill. It might be
a good idea to enclose one of the announcements to each of these
committee members as a reminder of what we are looking for — in
the event that they have lost theirs. Not important for Harwood
and Merrill but It is, I think, for the others.
I Just looked through my file and I cannot find a copy of the total
amount of money which we have to spend. I probably left It with
the folk of the files in Iowa City. Xou probably ought to include
this information with the proposals also. This will help the
committee members in their decision making.
I am enclosing a list of all members of the Speech Association of
America (with addresses), who have indicated an interest in radio¬
tv-film. Only a snail percentage ever come to our conventions,
thus, never received my little speech at the last convention.
It might prove worthwhile to send each a little notice about NAKB
individual memberships — except for those like Adkins, Harwood,
etc. who are already members.
I think the latest draft of the Understanding Media proposal is a
great inaapsxx improvement. I am still bothered by on© major point —
I am not certain of the limits of the proposal. It appears to me —
depending on how I read it — that there are many issues raised which
